instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165 (Intermittent back light)
threads.message:
I have seen this on a few boards now.  Intermittent back light.  I have one on the bench now. 
My plan is to just shotgun but wondered what others have done about this.

When it fails the LED voltage is 17-20v and is slowly fading away.  

Has anyone else fought this one?

threads.title: 820-00165 (Intermittent back light)
threads.message:
Maybe bad LCD connector.
Did you try known good LCD assembly?
Check XW7720 integrity.
Could also be bad solders at LP8550; especially FB ball.

threads.title: 820-00165 (Intermittent back light)
threads.message:
The intermittent is't physical.  I tested on bench with my known good display.  It worked.  Installed board and it didn't.  Tested again on bench and it didn't work. Then it worked. 
LP8550 looked good "perfect" looking under it. I checked all the sides with the scope.   There is no water damage on the back side of the board.   Via is good no corrosion damage.

threads.title: 820-00165 (Intermittent back light)
threads.message: Could be bad driver. Also make sure SMC_LID isn?t getting messed up by a corroded DC-in board/ cable
